content.question:
Caesari cum id nuntiatum esset, eos per provinciam nostram iter facere conari,

maturat ab urbe proficisci, et quam maximis potest itineribus in Galliam ulteriorem

contendit, et ad Genavam pervenit. Provinciae toti quam maximum potest militum

numerum imperat (erat omnino in Gallia ulteriore legio una), pontem qui erat ad

5Genavam iubet rescindi. Ubi de eius adventu Helvetii certiores facti sunt, legatos ad

eum mittunt nobilissimos civitatis.

Bellum Gallicum 1. 7

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. In lines 1-3 (Caesari . . . pervenit), which two Latin words make an indirect statement?

2. (A) What are the case and use of itineribus (line 2) and (B) what modifies it?

3. In lines 1-3 (Caesari . . . pervenit), which four Latin words mean that Caesar left Rome in a hurry?

4. (A) What are the case and use of Provinciae (line 3) and (B) what modifies it?

5. (A) What are the case and number of qui (line 4) and (B) to whom or what does it refer?

6. (A) Which one accusative noun and one infinitive are dependent on iubet (line 5) ? (B) Translate them in context.

7. In lines 3-6 (Provinciae . . . civitatis), which three Latin words mean that the Helvetians were informed of Caesar’s arrival?

8. In this passage, which three Latin words identify whom the Helvetians sent to discuss the matter with Caesar?

9. Briefly explain why, according to Book 1 of the Bellum Gallicum, Caesar sent the surviving Helvetians back to their original homeland. Answer in 1 complete sentence.
